N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 61-4.4 - Qualifications

State Regulations

The general provisions set forth at section
61-1.4
of this Part shall apply
under this Subpart except as follows: (a) Age. The minimum age of each applicant
for a certificate of competence shall be 21 years of age. (b) Experience. The minimum necessary
experience for each applicant shall be three years practical experience in the
handling and use of explosives. Such experience shall include knowledge of
explosive safety precautions, three years of actual experience as a blaster
outside of New York State or authorized blasting assistant on the types of
blasting operations that are covered by the particular classification being
sought and successful completion of at least two training courses recognized by
the blaster's examining board totaling 16 hours. (c) Renewals. Applicants for renewal shall
have successfully completed during the certification period at least two
blasting-related training courses that have been recognized by the blaster's
examining board totaling 16 hours. Notes
